info.description:
# dynpricepy
Dynamic pricing algorithms for python. Current version is 0.1.0, released on 28 december 2017.
Rely on pandas, scipy, numpy

dynpricepy is a library, written in python, to define and solve dynamic pricing algorithms.


It proposes automatic computation of associated probabilities, and
find the price to apply in order to maximize ...

## Getting started
To install:
```
pip3 install dynpricepy
```

Please visit the dynpricepy documentation for help with [installing Airflow](http://pythonhosted.org/airflow/installation.html), getting a [quick start](http://pythonhosted.org/airflow/start.html), or a more complete [tutorial](http://pythonhosted.org/airflow/tutorial.html).

For further information, please visit the [Airflow Wiki](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Airflow+Home).

## Example
For an elasticity model defined as $P[\text{sell};t,p]=e^{-p}$, we can define the pricing problem and solve it is as simple as this:

```
import numpy as np

# define the demand - price elasticity model
def elasticity_model(t, price, date):
    return np.exp(-price)

# create an instance of the object representing how each agent behave
agent_behavior = AgentBehaviour(probability_model=f_test_1)

# define the price path object with the agent_behavior instance
price_path = PricePath(agent_behavior=agent_behavior)

# compute the optimal price path
price_path.compute_price_path_one(t=10)

print(price_path)
```

which should output

```
Time 0, date 2017-12-27, price 1.000, selling probability 0.368, sold rate 0.842, sell today probability 0.092
Time 1, date 2017-12-28, price 1.300, selling probability 0.273, sold rate 0.749, sell today probability 0.094
Time 2, date 2017-12-29, price 1.600, selling probability 0.202, sold rate 0.656, sell today probability 0.087
Time 3, date 2017-12-30, price 1.820, selling probability 0.162, sold rate 0.568, sell today probability 0.083
Time 4, date 2017-12-31, price 1.980, selling probability 0.138, sold rate 0.485, sell today probability 0.083
Time 5, date 2018-01-01, price 2.120, selling probability 0.120, sold rate 0.402, sell today probability 0.082
Time 6, date 2018-01-02, price 2.240, selling probability 0.106, sold rate 0.321, sell today probability 0.081
Time 7, date 2018-01-03, price 2.350, selling probability 0.095, sold rate 0.240, sell today probability 0.080
Time 8, date 2018-01-04, price 2.440, selling probability 0.087, sold rate 0.160, sell today probability 0.080
Time 9, date 2018-01-05, price 2.530, selling probability 0.080, sold rate 0.080, sell today probability 0.080
```

You can also plot the results :
```
price_path.to_dataframe().set_index('t').plot(secondary_y='price')
```
![alt text](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hostnfly/dynpricepy/master/docs/img/example_1.png)

## Test yourself
Tested only on python 3.6.3

```
make init
source venv/bin/activate
make test
```

## Who uses dynpricepy?

As the dynpricepy community grows, we'd like to keep track of who is using
this library. Please send a PR with your company name if you may.


Currently **officially** using dynpricepy:

1. [Hostnfly](https://www.hostnfly.com/) [[@CyrilLeMat](https://github.com/CyrilLeMat) & [@pierrechopin](https://github.com/pierrechopin) & [@alexisrosuel](https://github.com/alexisrosuel)]
